hero.title: How PCG dog 'Appa' helped in rescue of 3-year-old landslide survivor in Davao de Oro
hero.description: A dog is not only a man's best friend, at times it is also its savior.

primary.title: Landslide in Davao de Oro mining village affects 300 families
primary.description: MANILA, Philippines — Some 300 families or 2,000 individuals were affected by the landslide in a mining village in Davao de Oro's Maco town, Civil Defense Administrator Ariel Nepomuceno

secondary.title: Death toll in Maco landslide rises to 11, over 100 missing
secondary.description: Rescuers dug out more bodies from a landslide-hit village of Masara in Maco town, Davao de Oro in Mindanao on Thursday, February 8, 2024, bringing the death tol

secondary.title: 28 bodies recovered from Davao De Oro landslide site
secondary.description: (Updated) The landslide in Davao De Oro has left 28 dead and 33 injured, as of Saturday.

secondary.title: NDRRMC: P738M infrastructure damage in Mindanao floods, landslides
secondary.description: According to the latest report from the <abbr title="National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council">NDRRMC</abbr>, infrastructure damage in Caraga and Davao region was estimated at P473 million and 265.6 million, respectively.

carousel.title: Only 1 public school in NCR got passing mark in 2022 PISA
carousel.description: Only one public school in Metro Manila scored above the minimum proficiency level in the Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA) 2022 global comprehension survey, a Department of Education (DepEd) official said Wednesday.

carousel.title: [Vantage Point] When sugar turns sour: End users agonize from high prices
carousel.description: The Marcos government should now give priority to the Filipino stakeholders of the Philippine sugar industry

carousel.title: Prospects shaky for Philippines’ government and communist peace talks
carousel.description: The two sides agreed to start talks this month, but continued fighting and mutual distrust have undermined process.

carousel.title: January inflation fell to 2.8%
carousel.description: Inflation dropped to 2.8% in January 2024, marking its slowest pace in over three years, the Philippine Statistics Authority said Tuesday. “This is the lowest recorded since the 2.3% inflation rate registered in October 2020,” said the PSA.
